articles.title: Dutch Baby & Pregnancy Vocabulary: Essential Words for Expecting Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Expecting a baby with your Dutch-speaking partner is an exciting journey. Learning the essential baby and pregnancy vocabulary in Dutch will help you participate fully in doctor visits, shopping for the babykamer, and those precious first conversations with your little one.

For everyday communication with your partner, check out our guide on [essential Dutch phrases for couples](/blog/en/essential-dutch-phrases-for-couples).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="baby"
  translation="baby"
  pronunciation="baby"
  context="The most important word for your growing family."
/>

## Essential Pregnancy Vocabulary

<VocabCard
  word="zwanger"
  translation="pregnant"
  pronunciation="zwanger"
  example="We're verwachten!"
/>

| Dutch | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| baby | baby | Your little one |
| zwanger | pregnant | The condition |
| verwachten | expecting | Anticipating baby |
| uitgerekende datum | due date | When baby arrives |
| echo | ultrasound | Seeing baby |
| babykamer | nursery | Baby's room |
| luier | diaper | Essential item |
| fles | bottle | For feeding |
| kinderwagen | stroller | For walks |
| wieg | crib | Baby's bed |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡±" title="Dutch Pregnancy Traditions">
In Dutch-speaking cultures, pregnancy is often celebrated with specific traditions. Baby showers, gender reveals, and family gatherings are common ways to welcome the new arrival. It's traditional to wait until after birth to buy certain items.
</CultureTip>

## Announcing the News

### To Your Partner's Family
- **We're verwachten a baby!** - The big announcement
- **You're going to be grandparents!** - For the parents
- **We have wonderful news!** - Building anticipation

### To Friends
- **We're having a baby!** - Direct and joyful
- **Our family is growing!** - Gentle announcement
- **Little one on the way!** - Cute phrasing

<VocabCard
  word="verwachten"
  translation="expecting"
  pronunciation="verwachten"
  example="We are verwachten in spring!"
/>

## At the Doctor's Office

Essential phrases for prenatal appointments:

| Dutch | English | When to Use |
|---|---|---|
| uitgerekende datum | due date | Asking about timeline |
| echo | ultrasound | For the scan |
| zwanger | pregnant | Medical discussions |
| Healthy baby | healthy baby | Good news |
| verwachten | expecting | General context |

### Questions to Ask
- **When is the uitgerekende datum?** - Timeline question
- **Is the baby healthy?** - Health check
- **When is the next echo?** - Appointment planning

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡±" title="Medical Appointments">
In Dutch-speaking healthcare settings, prenatal care may follow specific schedules. Having your partner help translate during appointments is invaluable, or bring a translation app as backup.
</CultureTip>

## Nursery and Baby Items

### Setting Up the babykamer

| Dutch | English | Description |
|---|---|---|
| wieg | crib | Baby's sleeping place |
| kinderwagen | stroller | For transportation |
| luier | diaper | Essential supplies |
| fles | bottle | Feeding equipment |
| babykamer | nursery | Baby's room |

### Shopping Vocabulary
- **We need luiers** - Basic necessity
- **Where are the fless?** - Store navigation
- **This wieg is perfect!** - Making choices
- **The kinderwagen fits well** - Practical decisions

<VocabCard
  word="babykamer"
  translation="nursery / baby's room"
  pronunciation="babykamer"
  example="We're decorating the babykamer."
/>

## Talking to Your Baby

Sweet phrases for your little one:

| Dutch Phrase | English | Moment |
|---|---|---|
| Hello, little baby | Hello, little baby | First greeting |
| I love you, baby | I love you, baby | Any moment |
| Sleep well, little one | Sleep well | Bedtime |
| Beautiful baby | Beautiful baby | Admiration |

## Baby Shower Vocabulary

| Dutch | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| baby shower | baby shower | The celebration |
| Gift for baby | baby gift | Presents |
| Congratulations | congratulations | Well-wishes |
| The babykamer | the nursery | Showing preparations |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡±" title="Baby Naming">
In Dutch-speaking cultures, baby names often carry family significance or honor loved ones. Discuss naming traditions with your partner early, as choosing a name that works in both languages can be important.
</CultureTip>

## After the Baby Arrives

First moments vocabulary:

### At the Hospital
- **The baby is here!** - Announcement
- **Healthy baby!** - Good news
- **Beautiful baby!** - First reactions

### First Days Home
- **Time to change the luier** - Daily care
- **The baby is hungry** - Feeding time
- **baby is sleeping** - Quiet time

For more family vocabulary, explore our [meeting your Dutch partner's family](/blog/en/meeting-your-dutch-partners-family) guide.

## Quick Reference Card

| Need | Vocabulary |
|---|---|
| Announcement | We're verwachten! |
| Doctor visit | uitgerekende datum, echo |
| Shopping | wieg, luier, fles |
| Daily care | baby, luier, fles |

Your journey into parenthood in two languages will give your baby the beautiful gift of bilingualism. Every word you learn in Dutch strengthens your family bond.

<CTA />

## La romance Ã  la russe

Le russe est une langue d'une profondeur Ã©motionnelle intense. Les Russes ne font pas les choses Ã  moitiÃ© en amour - c'est tout ou rien. Si votre cÅ“ur bat pour quelqu'un qui parle russe, ces phrases vous aideront Ã  exprimer vos sentiments avec la passion slave.

## Phrases de base pour charmer

### "Ğ¢Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ ĞºÑ€Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ/ĞºÑ€Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹"

Comparaison poÃ©tique trÃ¨s apprÃ©ciÃ©e dans la culture russe.

## Exprimer l'attirance profonde

### "Ğ¯ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ñƒ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµĞ±Ğµ"

**Prononciation :** ya nÃ© ma-GOU pÃ©-rÃ©-STAT DOU-mat o tÃ©-BYÃ‰

**Signification :** Je n'arrive pas Ã  arrÃªter de penser Ã  toi

Une confession romantique sincÃ¨re.

### "Ğ¢Ñ‹ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸ÑˆÑŒ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ Ñ ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°"

**Prononciation :** ti SZVO-dich mÃ©-NYA z ou-MA

### "Ğ¡ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ Ñ‡ÑƒĞ²ÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒÑ ÑĞµĞ±Ñ ÑÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼/ÑÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹"

**Prononciation :** z ta-BOÃ ya TCHOUV-stvou-you sÃ©-BYA stchass-LI-vim/stchass-LI-voÃ¯

**Signification :** Avec toi je me sens heureux/heureuse

## DÃ©clarations d'amour

### "Ğ¢Ñ‹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‘ Ğ²ÑÑ‘"
**Transcription :** Ty moyo vsyo
**Prononciation :** ti ma-YO VSYO

**Signification :** Tu es tout pour moi

Phrase courte mais extrÃªmement puissante en russe.

### "Ğ¯ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ»Ñ Ñ‚ĞµĞ±Ñ"
**Transcription :** Ya lyublyu tebya
**Prononciation :** ya lyou-BLYOU tÃ©-BYA

**Signification :** Je t'aime

La phrase la plus importante. Les Russes ne la prononcent pas Ã  la lÃ©gÃ¨re.

### "Ğ¢Ñ‹ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸"
**Transcription :** Ty lyubov vsey moey zhizni
**Prononciation :** ti lyou-BOV VSEÃ ma-YEÃ JIZ-ni

**Signification :** Tu es l'amour de toute ma vie

## Phrases tendres quotidiennes

### "Ğ¯ ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµĞ±Ğµ"
**Transcription :** Ya skuchayu po tebe
**Prononciation :** ya SKOU-tcha-you pa tÃ©-BYÃ‰

Ã€ utiliser quand vous Ãªtes sÃ©parÃ©s.

### "ĞĞ±Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ"
**Transcription :** Obnimi menya
**Prononciation :** ab-ni-MI mÃ©-NYA

**Signification :** Prends-moi dans tes bras

Demande tendre d'affection physique.

## Petits noms affectueux russes

Le russe est riche en diminutifs tendres :
- **Ğ¡Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ñ‹ÑˆĞºĞ¾** (solnyshko) - Petit soleil
- **Ğ—Ğ°Ğ¹ĞºĞ°/Ğ—Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğº** (zayka/zaychik) - Petit lapin
- **ĞšĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğº/ĞšĞ¸ÑĞ°** (kotik/kisa) - Petit chat
- **ĞœĞ¸Ğ»Ñ‹Ğ¹/ĞœĞ¸Ğ»Ğ°Ñ** (milyy/milaya) - Mon doux/Ma douce
- **Ğ›ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğ¹/Ğ›ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ** (lyubimy/lyubimaya) - Mon/Ma bien-aimÃ©(e)
- **Ğ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹/Ğ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ°Ñ** (rodnoy/rodnaya) - Mon/Ma chÃ©ri(e) (litt. "de ma famille")

## Conseils culturels russes

**IntensitÃ© Ã©motionnelle :** Les Russes vivent les Ã©motions pleinement. N'ayez pas peur d'Ãªtre expressif.

**Les fleurs comptent :** Offrir des fleurs est trÃ¨s important. Toujours en nombre impair (les nombres pairs sont pour les funÃ©railles).

**L'homme paie :** Traditionnellement, l'homme paie au restaurant. Cette tradition reste forte.

**Galanterie apprÃ©ciÃ©e :** Ouvrir les portes, aider avec le manteau - ces gestes sont valorisÃ©s.

**"Ğ¢Ñ‹" vs "Ğ’Ñ‹" :** Utilisez "Ñ‚Ñ‹" (tu) seulement quand vous Ãªtes proches. Le passage au "Ñ‚Ñ‹" est un moment significatif.

**Patience au dÃ©but :** Les Russes peuvent sembler rÃ©servÃ©s au dÃ©but, mais une fois la confiance Ã©tablie, ils sont trÃ¨s chaleureux.

## Conclusion

Le russe est une langue qui ne fait pas dans la demi-mesure en matiÃ¨re d'amour. Ces phrases vous permettront d'exprimer vos sentiments avec toute la profondeur et l'intensitÃ© que mÃ©rite votre partenaire russophone. L'effort d'apprendre ces mots sera profondÃ©ment apprÃ©ciÃ©. Ğ£Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ²Ğ¸ ! (Bonne chance en amour !)
